primarySegments.name: Urban Young Professionals
primarySegments.description: Tech-savvy individuals living in urban areas who rely on ride-sharing for daily commutes and social outings.

problemsNeeds: Need reliable transportation without owning a car
Desire for quick and easy payment options
Concerned about safety and driver reliability
behaviors: Use ride-sharing for both work and leisure

primarySegments.name: Suburban Families
primarySegments.description: Families living in suburban areas who use ride-sharing for occasional travel and family activities.

problemsNeeds: Need for larger vehicles for family trips
Desire for safe and vetted drivers
Occasional need for transportation without having to drive
behaviors: Value different service levels for different occasions

primarySegments.name: Frequent Business Travelers
primarySegments.description: Professionals who travel frequently for work and require reliable transportation in various cities.

problemsNeeds: Need for punctual and reliable service
Desire for luxury or comfort during travel
Require seamless payment and expense tracking
behaviors: Use ride-sharing for airport transfers and meetings
Rely on app for scheduling and tracking rides

excludedSegments.name: Rural Residents
excludedSegments.reason: Rural areas typically have lower demand for ride-sharing services due to longer distances and less frequent travel needs, making it less viable for drivers and the business model.

excludedSegments.name: Low-Income Individuals
excludedSegments.reason: This segment may find ride-sharing services too expensive compared to public transportation, limiting their usage frequency and overall contribution to the business's revenue.
